title: China provides demining equipment and training to Jordanian and Lebanese personnel
description: In 2006, the Chinese Government provided demining training and equipment to 40 Jordanian and Lebanese personnel. The opening ceremony for the training was held on September 25, 2006. The training was held in Nanjing. The Chinese instructors were from the People’s Liberation Army University of Science and Technology and its Engineering College. The three-month study training provided the Jordanian and Lebanese personnel with the basic theories of the PLA's mine clearance, its equipment operation and use, and the organization, command, and implementation of humanitarian mine clearance operations. The Chinese government also provided demining equipment to Jordan and Lebanon. Graduation was held on December 20, 2006.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 黎巴嫩约旦扫雷技术培训班.AidData has assumed that the opening ceremony was held on September 25, 2006, because that is the day the speech given at the opening ceremony was posted online. This project may be related to training courses promised by China to the Jordanian Government earlier in 2006 (captured by project ID#65310) because 20 Jordanians were trained, but the evidence is too shaky for AidData to consider them related. 'Year uncertain' box was checked because it is not confirmed that the agreement to provide the training was made in 2006.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China provides demining equipment and training to Jordanian and Lebanese personnel

# Description
In 2006, the Chinese Government provided demining training and equipment to 40 Jordanian and Lebanese personnel. The opening ceremony for the training was held on September 25, 2006. The training was held in Nanjing. The Chinese instructors were from the People’s Liberation Army University of Science and Technology and its Engineering College. The three-month study training provided the Jordanian and Lebanese personnel with the basic theories of the PLA's mine clearance, its equipment operation and use, and the organization, command, and implementation of humanitarian mine clearance operations. The Chinese government also provided demining equipment to Jordan and Lebanon. Graduation was held on December 20, 2006.
justification: Project focuses on humanitarian demining training and equipment provision, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Demining training and equipment provided to Jordanian and Lebanese personnel, humanitarian mine clearance operations

title: Chinese Government provide RMB 10 million grant — via ETCA — for provision of medical equipment
description: On May 20, 2006, the Chinese Government and the Government of Moldova signed an economic and technical cooperation agreement (ETCA), which committed RMB 10 million of grant funding for the provision of 400 medical devices to 73 republican, municipal, district, departmental and medical institutions from the eastern districts of Moldova. The equipment was specifically designed for resuscitation and intensive care units. It was successfully delivered by a Chinese contractor [China International Tendering Company (CITC)] on November 13, 2009.
staff_comments: The Romanian project title is Echipament 73 de instituţii medicale republicane, municipale, raionale, departamentale, precum şi instituţiile medicale din raioanele de est ale republicii. One Government of Moldova sources suggest that this project was funded through a November 14, 2007 ETCA rather than a May 20, 2006 ETCA. This issue merits further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government provide RMB 10 million grant — via ETCA — for provision of medical equipment

# Description
On May 20, 2006, the Chinese Government and the Government of Moldova signed an economic and technical cooperation agreement (ETCA), which committed RMB 10 million of grant funding for the provision of 400 medical devices to 73 republican, municipal, district, departmental and medical institutions from the eastern districts of Moldova. The equipment was specifically designed for resuscitation and intensive care units. It was successfully delivered by a Chinese contractor [China International Tendering Company (CITC)] on November 13, 2009.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare equipment provision without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Provision of 400 medical devices for healthcare institutions, resuscitation and intensive care focus

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 6 million for Bogd Khan Palace Museum Restoration Project
description: On May 27, 2006, China's State Administration of Cultural Heritage launched the implementation of the Bogd Khan Palace Museum Restoration Project. This project involved dispatching experts to restore the front gate and the ceremony square in the second of the two courtyards of the Bogd Khan Palace Museum. The Chinese Government reportedly committed RMB 6 million of grant funding for the implementation of the project. The project implementation period was expected to last two years and it was eventually completed. On October 8, 2007, the restoration of the museum was completed.
staff_comments: The Mongolian project title is Богд хааны ногоон ордон. Bogd Khan Palace Museum is a museum complex located in the city of Ulaanbaatar (exact locational coordinates: 47.8975, 106.906667). It was the Green Palace of the eighth Jebtsundamba Khutughtu, who was later proclaimed Bogd Khan, or ruler of Mongolia. The palace is the only one left from originally four residences of the Bogd Khan.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 6 million for Bogd Khan Palace Museum Restoration Project

# Description
On May 27, 2006, China's State Administration of Cultural Heritage launched the implementation of the Bogd Khan Palace Museum Restoration Project. This project involved dispatching experts to restore the front gate and the ceremony square in the second of the two courtyards of the Bogd Khan Palace Museum. The Chinese Government reportedly committed RMB 6 million of grant funding for the implementation of the project. The project implementation period was expected to last two years and it was eventually completed. On October 8, 2007, the restoration of the museum was completed.
justification: Project focuses on cultural heritage restoration with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Museum restoration project, cultural heritage focus, no energy-related components

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 115 million grant for Buyant Ukhaa Sport Palace Construction Project
description: In 2006, the Chinese Government and the Government of Mongolia signed a grant agreement for the Buyant Ukhaa Sport Palace Construction Project. China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) reportedly committed RMB 115 million of grant funding to support the project.   The purpose of the project was to construct an indoor sport stadium with 5045 seats and a height of 35.85 meters in the 10th khoroo of Ulaanbaatar’s Khan Uul district (exact locational coordinates: 47.854393984505585, 106.78488428086459). The stadium (known as the Buyant Ukhaa Sport Palace or Биеийн тамир спортын ордон) occupies a 4 hectare area and it is adjacent to the Chinggis Khaan International Airport. It can hold volleyball, basketball, badminton, wrestling, judo and other sports competitions. China Foreign Construction Engineering Design Consultant Co., Ltd. (also known as China Sino-Foreign Construction Engineering Design Consultants Co., Ltd.) was responsible for the design of the stadium. Shanghai Construction Group was responsible for its construction (and it was issued a construction contract worth RMB 106.45 million).   Construction commenced in May 2008. However, an official groundbreaking ceremony did not take place until June 20, 2008.  It was attended by Xi Jinping, who was at the time a member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee and vice chairman of the People’s Republic of China. Construction ended on November 20, 2010. On December 2, 2010, the project was officially completed and handed over to the local authorities. The originally anticipated project completion date was September 20, 2010.
staff_comments: This project is also known as the Mongolian National Stadium Construction Project. The Chinese project title is 援蒙古乌兰巴托体育馆项目 or 蒙古乌兰巴托体育馆项目 or 中国援建蒙古国家体育馆项目. The Mongolian project title is Биеийн тамир спортын ордон or Яармагийн Спортын цогцолборын барилга.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title

# Description

China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) reportedly committed RMB 115 million of grant funding to support the project.   The purpose of the project was to construct an indoor sport stadium with 5045 seats and a height of 35.85 meters in the 10th khoroo of Ulaanbaatar’s Khan Uul district (exact locational coordinates: 47.854393984505585, 106.78488428086459). The stadium (known as the Buyant Ukhaa Sport Palace or Биеийн тамир спортын ордон) occupies a 4 hectare area and it is adjacent to the Chinggis Khaan International Airport. It can hold volleyball, basketball, badminton, wrestling, judo and other sports competitions. China Foreign Construction Engineering Design Consultant Co., Ltd. (also known as China Sino-Foreign Construction Engineering Design Consultants Co., Ltd.) was responsible for the design of the stadium. Shanghai Construction Group was responsible for its construction (and it was issued a construction contract worth RMB 106.45 million).   Construction commenced in May 2008. However, an official groundbreaking ceremony did not take place until June 20, 2008.  It was attended by Xi Jinping, who was at the time a member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee and vice chairman of the People’s Republic of China. Construction ended on November 20, 2010. On December 2, 2010, the project was officially completed and handed over to the local authorities. The originally anticipated project completion date was September 20, 2010.
justification: Project is focused on social infrastructure development with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of indoor sports stadium, social development focus, no energy or industrial components

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 19 million grant for  Peace Bridge Renovation Project
description: On April 7, 2006, the Chinese Government and the Government of Mongolia signed an RMB 19 million grant agreement for the Peace Bridge Renovation Project.  The purpose of the project was to repair a 337 meter bridge that runs from north to south over the Selbe River in Ulaanbaatar’s Khan-Uul district (exact locational coordinates: 47.9076, 106.9129). The bridge was constructed between 1958 and 1963 with a grant from the Chinese Government grant but it eventually fell a state of disrepair and became a safety hazard.   In 2005, the Chinese Government dispatched experts to Mongolia to conduct a survey, inspect the bridge, and develop a maintenance plan. The bridge repair project was expected to commence in May 2006. Henan Provincial Communications Planning & Design institute Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for implementation. The project was started on May 13, 2006, and completed on December 21, 2007, but its precise implementation start date is unknown. After the completion of the project, local residents complained that the work that was performed was substandard.
staff_comments: The Mongolian project title is Энхтайвны гүүр or Энхтайвны гүүрийг засварлаж. The Chinese project title is 蒙古和平桥项目 or 蒙古国和平桥维修加固项目 or 援助蒙古国和平桥维修工程.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Description

The purpose of the project was to repair a 337 meter bridge that runs from north to south over the Selbe River in Ulaanbaatar’s Khan-Uul district (exact locational coordinates: 47.9076, 106.9129). The bridge was constructed between 1958 and 1963 with a grant from the Chinese Government grant but it eventually fell a state of disrepair and became a safety hazard.   In 2005, the Chinese Government dispatched experts to Mongolia to conduct a survey, inspect the bridge, and develop a maintenance plan. The bridge repair project was expected to commence in May 2006. Henan Provincial Communications Planning & Design institute Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for implementation. The project was started on May 13, 2006, and completed on December 21, 2007, but its precise implementation start date is unknown. After the completion of the project, local residents complained that the work that was performed was substandard.
justification: Bridge renovation project with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Focus on repairing existing bridge infrastructure, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides $3 million grant for Zamyn-Uud Container Inspection Complex Construction Project
description: In 2006, the Chinese Government provided a $3 million grant to the Government of Mongolia for the Zamyn-Uud Container Inspection Complex Construction Project. The purpose of the project was to construct a container inspection complex — complete with computer systems and X-ray machinery — at the Zamyn-Uud border post. The ultimate goal of the project was to achieve faster cargo clearance through customs. Container trucks and cargo trucks loaded with goods are escorted to this inspection site at the Zamyn-Uud border post. Clearance then takes about 3 to 5 minutes and images of the screening are captured and attached to cargo declarations. The screening report is also used to determine the extent of examination by customs officers when the containers are presented at the integrated clearance offices (ICOs). The project was completed and the handover ceremony for the project was held on January 7, 2006.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRADE POLICIES AND REGULATIONS

# Title
Chinese Government provides $3 million grant for Zamyn-Uud Container Inspection Complex Construction Project

# Description
In 2006, the Chinese Government provided a $3 million grant to the Government of Mongolia for the Zamyn-Uud Container Inspection Complex Construction Project. The purpose of the project was to construct a container inspection complex — complete with computer systems and X-ray machinery — at the Zamyn-Uud border post. The ultimate goal of the project was to achieve faster cargo clearance through customs. Container trucks and cargo trucks loaded with goods are escorted to this inspection site at the Zamyn-Uud border post. Clearance then takes about 3 to 5 minutes and images of the screening are captured and attached to cargo declarations. The screening report is also used to determine the extent of examination by customs officers when the containers are presented at the integrated clearance offices (ICOs). The project was completed and the handover ceremony for the project was held on January 7, 2006.
justification: Project focuses on customs and trade infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Container inspection complex construction, customs clearance improvement focus

title: Chinese Government donates materials worth RMB 10 million to Mohammed V Solidarity Fund
description: On 24 April 2006, Chinese President Hu Jintao arrived in Rabat, Morocco, kicking off his state visit to the country. During the visit President Hu Jintao committed to donating aid material worth 10 Million RMB to the Moroccan Mohammed V Solidarity (Arabic: مؤسسة محمد الخامس للتضامن‎) Fund. Aid material includes furniture, electrical appliances, computers, and materials such as jeeps, vans, and vehicles for the disabled. According to a statement put out by Embassy of China to Morocco, the aid materials will benefit nearly 200,000 children in 300 social centers across the country and several disability centers in remote areas.  On 14 February 2008, the handover ceremony of aid materials from the Chinese government to the Moroccan Mohammed V Solidarity Fund was held in Casablanca. Chinese Ambassador to Morocco Gong Yuanxing, Economic and Commercial Counselor, Qi Jianwei, General Coordinator of Mohammed V Solidarity Fund, El Azami, Board Director, Ben Musa, and other persons in charge of the foundation attended the handover ceremony.
combined_text:

Aid material includes furniture, electrical appliances, computers, and materials such as jeeps, vans, and vehicles for the disabled. According to a statement put out by Embassy of China to Morocco, the aid materials will benefit nearly 200,000 children in 300 social centers across the country and several disability centers in remote areas.  On 14 February 2008, the handover ceremony of aid materials from the Chinese government to the Moroccan Mohammed V Solidarity Fund was held in Casablanca. Chinese Ambassador to Morocco Gong Yuanxing, Economic and Commercial Counselor, Qi Jianwei, General Coordinator of Mohammed V Solidarity Fund, El Azami, Board Director, Ben Musa, and other persons in charge of the foundation attended the handover ceremony.
justification: Project involves donation of materials for social welfare purposes without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Aid materials include furniture, electrical appliances, computers, and vehicles for social centers and disability centers

title: Chinese Government provides musical and audio-visual equipment to Mozambique Ministry of Education and Culture worth $200,000
description: Mozambique's Deputy Minister of Education and Culture, Luis Covane, and the Chinese ambassador to Mozambique, Hong-Hong, signed the grant agreement on June 05, 2006 for 20,000 US dollars worth of musical and audio-visual equipment to the Mozambican Education and Culture Ministry.  The material includes acoustic guitars, drums, flutes, video cameras, and ballet equipment. These materials are to be distributed to Mozambican institutions working in the cultural arena, including the internationally acclaimed National Song and Dance Company (CNCD), the 'Casa da Cultura' (Culture House), and the Music School, among others.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides musical and audio-visual equipment to Mozambique Ministry of Education and Culture worth $200,000

# Description
Mozambique's Deputy Minister of Education and Culture, Luis Covane, and the Chinese ambassador to Mozambique, Hong-Hong, signed the grant agreement on June 05, 2006 for 20,000 US dollars worth of musical and audio-visual equipment to the Mozambican Education and Culture Ministry.  The material includes acoustic guitars, drums, flutes, video cameras, and ballet equipment. These materials are to be distributed to Mozambican institutions working in the cultural arena, including the internationally acclaimed National Song and Dance Company (CNCD), the 'Casa da Cultura' (Culture House), and the Music School, among others.
justification: Project focuses on cultural and educational development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Musical and audio-visual equipment for cultural institutions, education sector focus
